sources.name: requests
sources.query: sum(align(1m, sum, default(0, ts("aws.elb.requestcount.sum", Service=ELB and Region=*))))

sources.name: errors
sources.query: sum(align(1m, sum, default(0, ts("aws.elb.httpcode_*_5xx.sum", Service=ELB and Region=*))))

charts.name: Max Latency (last 10m)
charts.description: Use this chart to track the max latency seen recently from your ELBs. Consider changing the Single Stat -> Value Mapping to color code different tiers of latency.

charts.name: HTTP Code Errors (last 10m)
charts.description: Use this chart to track the errors per minute seen recently from your ELBs. Consider changing the Single Stat -> Value Mapping to color code different tiers of latency.

sources.name: New Query
sources.query: align(10m,sum,rawsum(collect(ts(aws.elb.httpcode*4xx.sum, Service=ELB and Region=*), ts(aws.elb.httpcode*5xx.sum, Service=ELB and Region=*))))

charts.name: Healthy Hosts
charts.description: The number of healthy instances in each Availability Zone. An instance is considered healthy if it meets the healthy threshold configured for the health checks. If cross-zone load balancing is enabled, the number of healthy instances is calculated across all Availability Zones.

sources.sourceDescription: This Alert Condition will trigger when the number of healthy hosts increases by 15% or more over a 5 minute period. Click "Create Alert" below to make this an alert in your environment.
sources.name: Alert Condition

charts.name: Unhealthy Hosts
charts.description: The number of unhealthy instances in each Availability Zone. An instance is considered unhealthy if it exceeds the unhealthy threshold configured for the health checks. If cross-zone load balancing is enabled, the number of unhealthy instances is calculated across all Availability Zones.

sources.sourceDescription: Enable this query to display when this condition (unhealthy hosts have increased by 10% in the last 5 minutes) would be triggered in your environment.  Click "Create Alert" below to create an alert based on this.
sources.name: Alert Condition

sources.sourceDescription: Alerts if the growth in total hosts over the last 5 minutes has been greater than 15%
sources.name: Alert Condition

charts.name: Request Count
charts.description: The number of completed requests that were received and routed to the registered instances.

charts.name: Latency
charts.description: The time elapsed, in seconds, after the request leaves the load balancer until a response is received.

charts.name: Spillover Count
charts.description: The total number of requests that were rejected because the queue was full.

charts.name: Surge Queue Length
charts.description: The total number of requests that are pending submission to a registered instance.

charts.name: ELB 5xx Errors
charts.description:
The number of HTTP 5XX server error codes generated by the load balancer when the listener is configured to use the HTTP or HTTPS protocol. This does not include any response codes generated by registered instances.

The metric is reported if there are no healthy instances registered to the load balancer, or if the request rate exceeds the capacity of the instances or the load balancer.

charts.name: Backend 2xx
charts.description: The number of HTTP response codes generated by registered instances. This does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.

charts.name: Backend 3xx
charts.description: The number of HTTP response codes generated by registered instances. This does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.

charts.name: Backend 4xx
charts.description: The number of HTTP response codes generated by registered instances. This does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.

charts.name: Backend 5xx
charts.description: The number of HTTP response codes generated by registered instances. This does not include any response codes generated by the load balancer.

charts.name: Backend Connection Errors
charts.description: The number of connections that were not successfully established between the load balancer and the registered instances. Because the load balancer retries the connection when there are errors, this count can exceed the request rate.

valuesToReadableStrings.6 Select AZ: , not Service=* and not Namespace=* and not LoadBalancerName=* and AvailabilityZone=${d_z_az})
valuesToReadableStrings.5 Select ELB: , not Service=* and not Namespace=* and LoadBalancerName=${d_z_elb} and not AvailabilityZone=*)
valuesToReadableStrings.2 Per ELB and AZ: , not Service=* and not Namespace=* and LoadBalancerName=* and AvailabilityZone=*)
valuesToReadableStrings.4 Per ELB only: , not Service=* and not Namespace=* and LoadBalancerName=* and not AvailabilityZone=*)
valuesToReadableStrings.3 Per AZ only: , not Service=* and not Namespace=* and not LoadBalancerName=* and AvailabilityZone=*)
valuesToReadableStrings.7 Select ELB and AZ: , not Service=* and not Namespace=* and LoadBalancerName=${d_z_elb} and AvailabilityZone=${d_z_az})
